decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing strong creatures with abilities that generate value and pressure opponents. The deck includes cards that provide mana acceleration and card advantage, along with key removal spells to deal with threats. The creatures in the deck have high power and toughness, allowing them to control the board and apply pressure on opponents. The deck aims to establish an early board presence and maintain pressure throughout the game, overwhelming opponents with powerful creatures and efficient spells. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Whip of Erebos and Soul of Theros provides the deck with additional resilience and versatility.

The key concept of this deck is to control the board by utilizing removal spells like Crackling Doom and Chained to the Rocks, while also generating value through cards like Butcher of the Horde and Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a mix of removal and threats, and close out the game with powerful finishers like Sorin, Solemn Visitor. The mana base is designed to support a mix of black, red, and white spells, ensuring the deck can consistently cast its powerful cards.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using powerful control cards like Perilous Vault, Dissolve, and Hero's Downfall to disrupt the opponent's strategy and keep the board under control. The deck also includes powerful card draw spells like Dig Through Time and Jace's Ingenuity to maintain card advantage. Additionally, cards like Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver and Despise are used to disrupt the opponent's hand and strategy. The deck aims to outlast the opponent while slowly grinding them down with efficient removal spells and card advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing removal spells like Crackling Doom, Lightning Strike, and Utter End to deal with opposing threats. It also aims to generate value through cards like Butcher of the Horde and Wingmate Roc, while maintaining board presence with cards like Goblin Rabblemaster and Hordeling Outburst. The deck's game plan is to control the board, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and eventually overwhelm them with a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to all its spells.

The deck focuses on aggressively using cards from the Sultai colors to control the board and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Sidisi, Brood Tyrant and Hornet Queen, along with removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Murderous Cut. Additionally, the deck includes graveyard recursion with Whip of Erebos and Soul of Innistrad to provide additional value and pressure on the opponent. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play powerful creatures such as Stormbreath Dragon, Ashcloud Phoenix, Savage Knuckleblade, Boon Satyr, and Heir of the Wilds to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Utilizing mana ramp creatures like Rattleclaw Mystic and Elvish Mystic, along with removal spells like Crater's Claws, Temur Charm, and Stubborn Denial, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain board control. With a mixture of haste, flying, and trample abilities, this aggressive Temur deck seeks to close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and casting powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Hornet Queen to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Commune with the Gods to help with card selection and filling up the graveyard for cards like Doomwake Giant and Whip of Erebos. There is a slight reanimator sub-theme with Soul of Innistrad and Whip of Erebos to bring back creatures from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to establish board presence early and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through removal spells and powerful creatures. With cards like Butcher of the Horde, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker, the deck aims to maintain board presence while dealing with threats using cards like Chained to the Rocks and Crackling Doom. The deck also includes some lifelink creatures like Seeker of the Way and Sorin, Solemn Visitor to help stabilize the player's life total. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of control elements and impactful threats.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Disdainful Stroke, while also removing threats with cards like Bile Blight and Hero's Downfall. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with Jace's Ingenuity and Dig Through Time, and ultimately win the game with powerful finishers like Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver and Pearl Lake Ancient. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to the necessary resources.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Azorius Heroic mechanic to quickly build up a strong board presence. By playing low-cost creatures like Hero of Iroas, Battlewise Hoplite, and Favored Hoplite, players can trigger heroic abilities and pump up their creatures with a variety of spells like Defiant Strike and Feat of Resistance. With cards like Aqueous Form and Stratus Walk providing evasion, and protection spells like Gods Willing and Stubborn Denial, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of aggressive, heroic creatures while ensuring they can't be easily removed.

The main idea behind this Golgari Aggro deck is to utilize cards that support a fast and aggressive playstyle while also benefiting from graveyard interactions. By including cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall for disruption, along with cards like Whip of Erebos for lifegain and recursion, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Hornet Queen and Doomwake Giant. Additionally, the deck includes mana ramping creatures like Courser of Kruphix and Sylvan Caryatid to ensure consistent mana production for the bigger threats in the deck.

The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to flood the board with small token creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Seeker of the Way, then pump them up with Jeskai Ascendancy and burn the opponent down with spells like Stoke the Flames and Lightning Strike. The deck also focuses on drawing cards with cards like Treasure Cruise to ensure a steady stream of threats. The mana base is built to support all three colors of the Jeskai wedge, allowing for flexibility in casting spells from any part of the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana with green creatures and lands in order to cast powerful spells and creatures ahead of schedule. By generating large amounts of mana, you can bring out powerful cards like Doomwake Giant, Hornet Queen, and Polukranos, World Eater to gain control of the game. Additionally, utilizing cards like Whip of Erebos and See the Unwritten can provide additional value and advantage to stay ahead of your opponent. Ultimately, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with strong creatures and powerful abilities while maintaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on maintaining board control through removal spells like Crackling Doom and Chained to the Rocks, while also generating token creatures with cards like Hordeling Outburst and Goblin Rabblemaster. Butcher of the Horde provides a powerful threat on the battlefield, while cards like Seeker of the Way and Wingmate Roc help stabilize your life total. Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker offer powerful late-game finishers, while planeswalkers like Chandra, Pyromaster and Sorin, Solemn Visitor provide additional value and utility. The aim is to grind out incremental advantages and ultimately out-value your opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage as efficiently as possible. By playing low-cost creatures such as Firedrinker Satyr, Monastery Swiftspear, Akroan Crusader, and Satyr Hoplite, and supporting them with cards like Hammerhand, Dragon Mantle, and Titan's Strength, the deck aims to build a strong board presence early on. The burn spells like Lightning Strike, Arc Lightning, Magma Spray, and Stoke the Flames provide reach to finish off the opponent or clear blockers. Overall, this deck is all about fast, aggressive play to win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on using efficient and powerful creatures like Siege Rhino, Courser of Kruphix, and Anafenza, the Foremost to quickly put pressure on the opponent and end the game swiftly. It also includes disruption and removal spells like Thoughtseize, Hero's Downfall, and Abzan Charm to control the board and make it difficult for the opponent to stabilize. The combination of aggressive threats and versatile removal makes it a strong and consistent deck in the Standard 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By utilizing mana acceleration from Elvish Mystic and Rattleclaw Mystic, as well as powerful creatures like Stormbreath Dragon and Polukranos, World Eater, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Chandra, Pyromaster provides additional card advantage and removal, while Crater's Claws can serve as a finisher. Overall, this deck aims to win the game through early aggression and efficient damage output.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a wide board presence with low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Seeker of the Way, while also utilizing token generators such as Hordeling Outburst and Raise the Alarm. Jeskai Charm and Jeskai Ascendancy provide ways to pump up your creatures and push through damage, with Retraction Helix enabling additional benefits from your creatures' enter-the-battlefield abilities. The deck includes a mix of card draw and mana fixing to ensure consistency in your plays and maintain pressure on your opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard to consistently bring back threats and outvalue the opponent. By using cards like Whip of Erebos and Commune with the Gods, it ensures a steady stream of threats while also providing some control with removal spells like Murderous Cut. The deck also aims to ramp up with mana acceleration from cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Elvish Mystic, allowing for quick powerful plays with large creatures like Hornet Queen and Doomwake Giant to overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal a large amount of damage. By playing cards like Goblin Rabblemaster, Hordeling Outburst, and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to establish an early advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. Jeskai Ascendancy and Seeker of the Way provide additional support and synergy, while cards like Chandra, Pyromaster and Treasure Cruise help maintain card advantage and ensure consistency in the deck's strategy. The mana base is designed to support a fast-paced tempo and provide access to all three colors of mana necessary for the deck's spells.

The main focus of the deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells with cards like Dissolve, Disdainful Stroke, and Thoughtseize, while also using removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Bile Blight to deal with threats on the board. The deck utilizes card draw spells like Jace's Ingenuity and Dig Through Time to ensure it has the resources it needs to maintain control. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast the opponent and win through card advantage with the powerful finisher, Pearl Lake Ancient.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with cheap creatures and token generators like Raise the Alarm and Hordeling Outburst, while utilizing burn spells like Lightning Strike and Stoke the Flames to clear a path for your creatures to attack. The addition of powerful creatures like Wingmate Roc and Eidolon of Countless Battles ensures that your attacks are impactful and difficult to defend against. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to both red and white mana sources to cast your spells efficiently.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful direct damage spells. By using creatures like Fanatic of Xenagos and Heir of the Wilds to apply early pressure, and powerful finishers like Stormbreath Dragon and Polukranos, World Eater to seal the deal. Alongside efficient removal spells like Lightning Strike and Crater's Claws, this deck aims to quickly bring the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize or mount a defense. Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker provides additional reach and removal to further push towards victory.

The Sultai Aggro deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion, removal spells, and powerful creatures to overwhelm opponents quickly. It aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize, while also ramping up its own resources with cards like Courser of Kruphix and Satyr Wayfinder. The deck utilizes cards like Whip of Erebos and Soul of Innistrad to bring back key creatures from the graveyard, while also applying pressure with cards like Hornet Queen and Sidisi, Brood Tyrant. With a solid mana base and a mix of aggro and control elements, this deck can adapt to different situations effectively.
